alert.note: Alert for Central Horry; Coastal Georgetown; Florence; Inland Georgetown; Marion; Northern Horry; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 4:49AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Florence, northwestern Georgetown, western Horry, Marion and northeast Williamsburg Counties through 545 AM EDT... At 447 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Outland, or 18 miles southwest of Conway, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Very heavy rain will reduce visibilities when driving. Locations impacted include... Marion, Mullins, Johnsonville, Hemingway, Rhems, Galivants Ferry, Zion, Pee Dee Crossroads, Oatland, Gapway, Poston, Brittons Neck, Rains, Dongola, Plantersville, Outland, Gresham, Kingsburg, Aynor and Nichols. This includes SC Highway 22 near mile marker 1. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Horry; Coastal Georgetown; Florence; Inland Georgetown; Marion; Northern Horry; Williamsburg
